A crossword is a word puzzle that normally takes the form of a square or a 
rectangular grid of white and black shaded squares. The goal is to fill the white 
squares with letters, forming words or phrases, by solving clues which lead to the 
answers. In languages that are written left-to-right, the answer words and phrases 
are .... The New York Times puzzles also set a common pattern for American...
